meanings.sent1: The dyslogistic remarks made by the teacher were not helpful.
meanings.sent2: Her dyslogistic comments about the movie were quite harsh.
meanings.sent3: Even though it was meant as a joke, his dyslogistic feedback hurt her feelings.
meanings.sent4: The dyslogistic tone in her voice made it clear she was not pleased.
meanings.sent5: The dyslogistic review of the restaurant spread quickly among the neighbors.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of approval or praise
meanings.sent1: The dyslogistic attitude of the boss affected the team's morale.
meanings.sent2: His dyslogistic reaction to her idea was disappointing.
meanings.sent3: Despite the dyslogistic response, she continued to work hard.
meanings.sent4: The dyslogistic expression on his face revealed his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The dyslogistic feedback from the audience was unexpected.
